text.div:
BC BreastCancerPresenceStatement Logical Model

FindingTopic or diagnosis of cancer originating in the tissues of the breast, and potentially spread to other organs of the body. The BreastCancerPresenceStatement is a subclass of ConditionPresenceStatement, which is a departure from CIMI. In CIMI, this would be a archetype of ClinicalStatement combining a BreastCancerConditionTopic with the ConditionPresenceContext. This would require definition of BreastCancerConditionTopic in the reference model, follwed by introduction of constraints on Value, Category, Stage, and MorphologyBehavior in the corresponding archetype.

name: BreastCancerPresenceStatement
title: BC BreastCancerPresenceStatement Logical Model
publisher: The HL7 Cancer Interoperability Group sponsored by Clinical Interoperability Council Work Group (CIC).
description:
FindingTopic or diagnosis of cancer originating in the tissues of the breast, and potentially spread to other organs of the body.

The BreastCancerPresenceStatement is a subclass of ConditionPresenceStatement, which is a departure from CIMI. In CIMI, this would be a archetype of ClinicalStatement combining a BreastCancerConditionTopic with the ConditionPresenceContext. This would require definition of BreastCancerConditionTopic in the reference model, follwed by introduction of constraints on Value, Category, Stage, and MorphologyBehavior in the corresponding archetype.

element.definition:
FindingTopic or diagnosis of cancer originating in the tissues of the breast, and potentially spread to other organs of the body.

The BreastCancerPresenceStatement is a subclass of ConditionPresenceStatement, which is a departure from CIMI. In CIMI, this would be a archetype of ClinicalStatement combining a BreastCancerConditionTopic with the ConditionPresenceContext. This would require definition of BreastCancerConditionTopic in the reference model, follwed by introduction of constraints on Value, Category, Stage, and MorphologyBehavior in the corresponding archetype.

element.short: Code representing findingTopic or diagnosis of cancer originating in the tissues of the breast, and potentially spread to other organs of the body.
element.definition:
Code representing findingTopic or diagnosis of cancer originating in the tissues of the breast, and potentially spread to other organs of the body.

The BreastCancerPresenceStatement is a subclass of ConditionPresenceStatement, which is a departure from CIMI. In CIMI, this would be a archetype of ClinicalStatement combining a BreastCancerConditionTopic with the ConditionPresenceContext. This would require definition of BreastCancerConditionTopic in the reference model, follwed by introduction of constraints on Value, Category, Stage, and MorphologyBehavior in the corresponding archetype.

element.short: The concept representing the finding or action that is the topic of the statement.
element.definition:
The concept representing the finding or action that is the topic of the statement. 
		
		For action topics, the TopicCode represents the action being described. For findings, the TopicCode represents the 'question' or property being investigated. For evaluation result findings, the TopicCode contains a concept for an observable entity, such as systolic blood pressure. For assertion findings, the TopicCode contains a code representing the condition, allergy, or other item being asserted. In all cases, the TopicCode describes the topic independent of the context of the action or the finding.
		
		This attribute was named 'key' in CIMI V0.0.4. Recently, CIMI has recently moved to rename this element TopicCode, as anticipated here, to make it more clear that this is an identifier for the topic, not the context.

element.short: The technique used to create the finding, for example, the specific imaging technical, lab test code, or assessment vehicle. In CIMI Version 0.0.4, this attribute is called 'method'.
element.definition: The technique used to create the finding, for example, the specific imaging technical, lab test code, or assessment vehicle. In CIMI Version 0.0.4, this attribute is called 'method'.

element.short: Code representing the technique used to create the finding, for example, the specific imaging technical, lab test code, or assessment vehicle. In CIMI Version 0.0.4, this attribute is called 'method'.
element.definition: Code representing the technique used to create the finding, for example, the specific imaging technical, lab test code, or assessment vehicle. In CIMI Version 0.0.4, this attribute is called 'method'.

element.short: A class or division of people or things having particular shared characteristics
element.definition: A class or division of people or things having particular shared characteristics

element.short: Code representing a class or division of people or things having particular shared characteristics
element.definition: Code representing a class or division of people or things having particular shared characteristics

element.short: xml:id (or equivalent in JSON)
element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.short: Additional Content defined by implementations
element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

element.short: Identity of the terminology system
element.definition: The identification of the code system that defines the meaning of the symbol in the code.
element.comment: The URI may be an OID (urn:oid:...) or a UUID (urn:uuid:...).  OIDs and UUIDs SHALL be references to the HL7 OID registry. Otherwise, the URI should come from HL7's list of FHIR defined special URIs or it should de-reference to some definition that establish the system clearly and unambiguously.
element.requirements: Need to be unambiguous about the source of the definition of the symbol.

element.short: Version of the system - if relevant
element.definition: The version of the code system which was used when choosing this code. Note that a well-maintained code system does not need the version reported, because the meaning of codes is consistent across versions. However this cannot consistently be assured. and when the meaning is not guaranteed to be consistent, the version SHOULD be exchanged.
element.comment: Where the terminology does not clearly define what string should be used to identify code system versions, the recommendation is to use the date (expressed in FHIR date format) on which that version was officially published as the version date.

element.short: Symbol in syntax defined by the system
element.definition: A symbol in syntax defined by the system. The symbol may be a predefined code or an expression in a syntax defined by the coding system (e.g. post-coordination).
element.requirements: Need to refer to a particular code in the system.

element.short: Representation defined by the system
element.definition: A representation of the meaning of the code in the system, following the rules of the system.
element.requirements: Need to be able to carry a human-readable meaning of the code for readers that do not know  the system.

mapping.map: C*E.2 - but note this is not well followed

element.short: If this coding was chosen directly by the user
element.definition: Indicates that this coding was chosen by a user directly - i.e. off a pick list of available items (codes or displays).
element.comment: Amongst a set of alternatives, a directly chosen code is the most appropriate starting point for new translations. There is some ambiguity about what exactly 'directly chosen' implies, and trading partner agreement may be needed to clarify the use of this element and its consequences more completely.
element.requirements: This has been identified as a clinical safety criterium - that this exact system/code pair was chosen explicitly, rather than inferred by the system based on some rules or language processing.

mapping.map: fhir:Coding.userSelected fhir:mapsTo dt:CDCoding.codingRationale. fhir:Coding.userSelected fhir:hasMap fhir:Coding.userSelected.map. fhir:Coding.userSelected.map a fhir:Map;   fhir:target dt:CDCoding.codingRationale. fhir:Coding.userSelected\#true a [     fhir:source "true";     fhir:target dt:CDCoding.codingRationale\#O   ]

element.short: A body site entity or a body site code.
element.definition: A body site entity or a body site code.

element.short: The context for a condition that is known, suspected, or possibly present.
element.definition:
The context for a condition that is known, suspected, or possibly present.

In CIMI Version 0.0.4, this class was called AssertionKnownOrSuspectedPresent. The corresponding CIMI class is ungoing a name change to include the word 'StatementContext' and remove the word 'Assertion'.

The presence of terminology bindings (necessary to align with FHIR clinicalStatus, severity, and criticality) means that this class cannot be defined entirely within the CIMI reference model. The constraints could only exist in an archetype derived from the reference model class. The logical model here represents both the class structure and the terminology bindings.

element.short: A code representing the ontological status of the statement, e.g., whether it exists, does not exist, is planned, etc.
element.definition:
A code representing the ontological status of the statement, e.g., whether it exists, does not exist, is planned, etc. 
		
		Attribute aligns with the SNOMED CT Situation with Explicit Context (SWEC) Concept Model context attributes: 'Finding context (attribute)' (SCTID: 408729009) and 'Procedure context (attribute)' (SCTID: 408730004). The range allowed for this attribute shall be consistent with the SNOMED CT concept model specification for SWEC.
		
		This attribute was named 'type' in CIMI V0.0.4. However, CIMI has recently moved to rename this element ContextCode, as anticipated here, to make it more clear that this is an identifier for the context, not the topic.

element.short: Code representing a code representing the ontological status of the statement, e.g., whether it exists, does not exist, is planned, etc.
element.definition:
Code representing a code representing the ontological status of the statement, e.g., whether it exists, does not exist, is planned, etc. 
		
		Attribute aligns with the SNOMED CT Situation with Explicit Context (SWEC) Concept Model context attributes: 'Finding context (attribute)' (SCTID: 408729009) and 'Procedure context (attribute)' (SCTID: 408730004). The range allowed for this attribute shall be consistent with the SNOMED CT concept model specification for SWEC.
		
		This attribute was named 'type' in CIMI V0.0.4. However, CIMI has recently moved to rename this element ContextCode, as anticipated here, to make it more clear that this is an identifier for the context, not the topic.

element.short: Whether an assessment has been confirmed by testing or observation.
element.definition: Whether an assessment has been confirmed by testing or observation.

element.short: Code representing whether an assessment has been confirmed by testing or observation.
element.definition: Code representing whether an assessment has been confirmed by testing or observation.

element.short: The beginning or first appearance of a mental or physical disorder.
element.definition:
The beginning or first appearance of a mental or physical disorder.
			This attribute aligns with FHIR Condition.onset, and with dateOfOnset and ageAtOnset in CIMI Version 0.0.4 but includes additional datatypes corresponding to FHIR

element.short: The end of the condition, either remission or resolution. This attribute corresponds to dateAbated and hasAbated in CIMI Version 0.0.4, but includes additional datatypes corresponding to FHIR
element.definition: The end of the condition, either remission or resolution. This attribute corresponds to dateAbated and hasAbated in CIMI Version 0.0.4, but includes additional datatypes corresponding to FHIR

element.short: The degree of confidence in a conclusion or assertion.
element.definition: The degree of confidence in a conclusion or assertion.

element.short: A flag indicating whether the condition is active or inactive, recurring, in remission, or resolved (as of the last update of the Condition).
element.definition: A flag indicating whether the condition is active or inactive, recurring, in remission, or resolved (as of the last update of the Condition).

element.short: Code representing a flag indicating whether the condition is active or inactive, recurring, in remission, or resolved (as of the last update of the Condition).
element.definition: Code representing a flag indicating whether the condition is active or inactive, recurring, in remission, or resolved (as of the last update of the Condition).

element.short: If the problem or condition existed before the current episode of care.
element.definition: If the problem or condition existed before the current episode of care.

element.short: Degree of harshness or extent of a symptom, disorder, or condition.
element.definition: Degree of harshness or extent of a symptom, disorder, or condition.

element.short: Code representing degree of harshness or extent of a symptom, disorder, or condition.
element.definition: Code representing degree of harshness or extent of a symptom, disorder, or condition.

element.short: The potential clinical harm associated with a condition. When the worst case result is assessed to have a life-threatening or organ system threatening potential, it is considered to be of high criticality.
element.definition: The potential clinical harm associated with a condition. When the worst case result is assessed to have a life-threatening or organ system threatening potential, it is considered to be of high criticality.

element.short: Code representing the potential clinical harm associated with a condition. When the worst case result is assessed to have a life-threatening or organ system threatening potential, it is considered to be of high criticality.
element.definition: Code representing the potential clinical harm associated with a condition. When the worst case result is assessed to have a life-threatening or organ system threatening potential, it is considered to be of high criticality.

element.short: The relative advancement in the course of a disease. The value is the summary stage or stage group. StageDetail optionally contains the full staging information.
element.definition:
The relative advancement in the course of a disease. The value is the summary stage or stage group. StageDetail optionally contains the full staging information.
			
			This attribute does not have a direct analogy in CIMI V0.0.4 (the closest being ConditionAssertion.diseasePhase), but is included here for consistency with FHIR and because staging is important in the context of breast cancer and cancer in general.

element.short: Code representing the relative advancement in the course of a disease. The value is the summary stage or stage group. StageDetail optionally contains the full staging information.
element.definition:
Code representing the relative advancement in the course of a disease. The value is the summary stage or stage group. StageDetail optionally contains the full staging information.
			
			This attribute does not have a direct analogy in CIMI V0.0.4 (the closest being ConditionAssertion.diseasePhase), but is included here for consistency with FHIR and because staging is important in the context of breast cancer and cancer in general.

element.short: The full staging information
element.definition: The full staging information

element.short: A description of the morphology characteristics of the cancer.
element.definition: A description of the morphology characteristics of the cancer.

element.short: Code representing a description of the morphology characteristics of the cancer.
element.definition: Code representing a description of the morphology characteristics of the cancer.

element.short: The context for a condition that is known, suspected, or possibly present.
element.definition:
The context for a condition that is known, suspected, or possibly present.

In CIMI Version 0.0.4, this class was called AssertionKnownOrSuspectedPresent. The corresponding CIMI class is ungoing a name change to include the word 'StatementContext' and remove the word 'Assertion'.

The presence of terminology bindings (necessary to align with FHIR clinicalStatus, severity, and criticality) means that this class cannot be defined entirely within the CIMI reference model. The constraints could only exist in an archetype derived from the reference model class. The logical model here represents both the class structure and the terminology bindings.

The range allowed for this attribute shall be consistent with the SNOMED CT concept model specification for SWEC.
